result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven L Beddome was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 3 days granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Any remaining fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Menomonee Falls Police Department.  Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

Continue with AODA treatment.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either March 18, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions-To commence FORTHWITH.  Defendant may also have release to participate in ATC assessment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 200 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute Sobriety, Random urine screens. Comply with testing with any department of Corrections testing rules to check for alcohol or controlled substances. Sign releases for agent.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Unpaid balance of fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
  Court ordered financial obligations payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

Defendant Steven L Beddome in court, in custody, with attorney John Miller Carroll.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Carroll makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following: 
39 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 200 days )
15 Months of Initial Confinement
24 Months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Sign any Release for Agent;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Comply with testing with any deparment of corrections testing rules to check for alcohol or controlled substances.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven L Beddome in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  

Court orders the following: 
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days.
- 2 years Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either March 18, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- Fine of $1,771.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $60.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Menomonee Falls Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- DNA Sample waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment.

CONDITION TIME: 180 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.  Defendant may also have release to participate in ATC assessment.
